meanings.definition: The quality of being able to hang or fall in graceful folds.
meanings.sent1: The curtains were chosen for their drapability, allowing them to hang elegantly in the living room.
meanings.sent2: The silk fabric's drapability made it perfect for creating flowing evening gowns.
meanings.sent3: The magician's cape had such great drapability that it seemed to move on its own during the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had such drapability that it almost seemed to dance with her as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The drapability of the fabric was so impressive that it caught everyone's attention at the fashion show.

meanings.definition: The ability of a fabric to drape or hang smoothly.
meanings.sent1: When choosing a fabric for the curtains, she considered not only the color but also its drapability.
meanings.sent2: The designer selected a fabric known for its excellent drapability to create a stunning evening gown.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot on the couch, nestled in the soft drapability of the blanket.
meanings.sent4: The drapability of the fabric was so perfect that it seemed to defy gravity as it hung from the ceiling.
meanings.sent5: The drapability of the material was so smooth that it felt like a gentle caress against the skin.
